text: {| |} Chōkai Maru was an auxiliary patrol boat of the Imperial Japanese Navy during World War II. ==History== Chōkai Maru was laid down on 14 September 1936 at the shipyard of Mitsubishi Jukogyo Hikoshima Zosensho. She was launched on 28 June 1936 and completed on 15 February 1937. On 5 September 1941, she was requisitioned by the Imperial Japanese Navy and converted to an auxiliary patrol boat. She was assigned to 1st platoon, Patrol division 7, 5th Fleet along with , , and . On 2 March 1945, she was torpedoed and sunk by north-east of Miyake-jima (). On 10 May 1945 she was struck from the Navy list. ==References== Category:1936 ships Category:Ships built in Japan Category:Maritime incidents in March 1945
title: Japanese patrol boat Chōkai Maru
